author: nc1234
content: <@845691100072509460> I am looking at your geth's commit history https://github.com/jihoonsong/go-ethereum/commits/focil/ are these new commits or just the result of a git rebase? Asking because I am trying to call geth with `engine_updatePayloadWithInclusionListV1` and got a timeout

author: jih2nn
content: It's just a rebase. It would give you the same result but you might want to try out this image? This is the latest one that I built yesterday (same commits but the latest rebased one): https://github.com/jihoonsong/local-devnet-focil/blob/main/kurtosis/kurtosis.config.registry.yaml#L3

author: jih2nn
content:
So I guess FOCIL fork is "eip7805", right? Should we need to change beacon API's version from "focil" to "eip7805" then?

https://github.com/ensi321/beacon-APIs/blob/focil/apis/eventstream/index.yaml#L156-L160

author: terencechain
content: Amazing, is there a docker image to try? üôÇ

author: nflaig
content: needs to be changed to align it with config values, I also think it's better to use `eip<number>` instead some name we come up with, we can also look into getting this merged at some point before FOCIL in confirmed for a hard fork, we might wanna use EIP specific tags on the api for that to separate those in the explorer. Right now  we use "Draft" as tag but if there are more apis added for some EIPs (eg. ebps) then we likely wanna separate those

author: jih2nn
content: Sounds good! I'm currently implementing beacon API and I'll use "eip7805" instead of "focil". Thanks!

author: nflaig
content: I just updated the spec as well

content: it's a draft. is there any good reason it should wait till glamsterdam?

author: nc1234
content: One counter argument would be we want to ship peerdas asap and we kinda get tired of the constant scope creep we‚Äôve experienced in Pectra. iirc the current focil spec is not final and we want to explore different flavours of focil as well

author: nc1234
content: But I guess you are only adding it to PFI. We can always have this discussion later onüëç
